36 
38 //
39 // Defines the PlannerManager class, which listens for new trajectory
40 // messages and, on a timer, repeatedly queries the current trajectory and
41 // publishes the corresponding reference.
42 //
43 // The PlannerManager is also responsible for requesting new plans.
44 // This base class only calls the planner once upon takeoff; as needs will vary
45 // derived classes may add further functionality such as receding
46 // horizon planning.
47 //
49 
50 #ifndef FASTRACK_PLANNING_PLANNER_MANAGER_H
51 #define FASTRACK_PLANNING_PLANNER_MANAGER_H
52 
53 #include <fastrack/trajectory/trajectory.h>
54 #include <fastrack/utils/types.h>
55 #include <fastrack/utils/uncopyable.h>
56 
57 #include <fastrack_msgs/ReplanRequest.h>
58 
59 #include <ros/ros.h>
60 #include <visualization_msgs/Marker.h>
61 #include <std_msgs/Empty.h>
62 #include <geometry_msgs/Vector3.h>
63 #include <geometry_msgs/TransformStamped.h>
64 #include <tf2_ros/transform_broadcaster.h>
65 
66 namespace fastrack {
67 namespace planning {
68 
69 using trajectory::Trajectory;
70 
71 template<typename S>
72 class PlannerManager : private Uncopyable {
73 public:
74  virtual ~PlannerManager() {}
75  explicit PlannerManager()
76  : ready_(false),
77  waiting_for_traj_(false),
78  initialized_(false) {}
79 
80  // Initialize this class with all parameters and callbacks.
81  bool Initialize(const ros::NodeHandle& n);
82 
83 protected:
84  // Load parameters and register callbacks. These may be overridden, however
85  // derived classes should still call these functions.
86  virtual bool LoadParameters(const ros::NodeHandle& n);
87  virtual bool RegisterCallbacks(const ros::NodeHandle& n);
88 
89  // If not already waiting, request a new trajectory that starts along the
90  // current trajectory at the state corresponding to when the planner will
91  // return, and ends at the goal location. This may be overridden by derived
92  // classes with more specific replanning needs.
93  virtual void MaybeRequestTrajectory();
94 
95  // Callback for applying tracking controller. This may be overridden, however
96  // derived classes should still call thhis function.
97  virtual void TimerCallback(const ros::TimerEvent& e);
98 
99  // Callback for processing trajectory updates.
100  inline void TrajectoryCallback(const fastrack_msgs::Trajectory::ConstPtr& msg) {
101  traj_ = Trajectory<S>(msg);
102  traj_.Visualize(traj_vis_pub_, fixed_frame_);
103 
104  waiting_for_traj_ = false;
105  }
106 
107  // Is the system ready?
108  inline void ReadyCallback(const std_msgs::Empty::ConstPtr& msg) {
109  ready_ = true;
110  }
111 
112  // Generate a new trajectory request when environment has been updated.
113  inline void UpdatedEnvironmentCallback(const std_msgs::Empty::ConstPtr& msg) {
114  MaybeRequestTrajectory();
115  }
116 
117  // Current trajectory.
118  Trajectory<S> traj_;
119 
120  // Planner runtime -- how long does it take for the planner to run.
121  double planner_runtime_;
122 
123  // Are we waiting for a new trajectory?
124  bool waiting_for_traj_;
125 
126  // Start/goal states.
127  fastrack_msgs::State start_;
128  fastrack_msgs::State goal_;
129 
130  // Set a recurring timer for a discrete-time controller.
131  ros::Timer timer_;
132  double time_step_;
133 
134  // Publishers/subscribers and related topics.
135  ros::Publisher bound_pub_;
136  ros::Publisher ref_pub_;
137  ros::Publisher replan_request_pub_;
138  ros::Publisher traj_vis_pub_;
139  ros::Subscriber traj_sub_;
140  ros::Subscriber ready_sub_;
141  ros::Subscriber updated_env_sub_;
142 
143  std::string bound_topic_;
144  std::string ref_topic_;
145  std::string replan_request_topic_;
146  std::string traj_vis_topic_;
147  std::string traj_topic_;
148  std::string ready_topic_;
149  std::string updated_env_topic_;
150 
151  // Frames of reference for publishing markers.
152  std::string fixed_frame_;
153  std::string planner_frame_;
154 
155  // Transform broadcaster for planner position.
156  tf2_ros::TransformBroadcaster tf_broadcaster_;
157 
158  // Are we in flight?
159  bool ready_;
160 
161  // Naming and initialization.
162  std::string name_;
163  bool initialized_;
164 };
165 
166 // ---------------------------- IMPLEMENTATION ------------------------------ //
167 
168 // Initialize this class with all parameters and callbacks.
169 template<typename S>
170 bool PlannerManager<S>::Initialize(const ros::NodeHandle& n) {
171  name_ = ros::names::append(n.getNamespace(), "PlannerManager");
172 
173  // Load parameters.
174  if (!LoadParameters(n)) {
175  ROS_ERROR("%s: Failed to load parameters.", name_.c_str());
176  return false;
177  }
178 
179  // Register callbacks.
180  if (!RegisterCallbacks(n)) {
181  ROS_ERROR("%s: Failed to register callbacks.", name_.c_str());
182  return false;
183  }
184 
185  initialized_ = true;
186  return true;
187 }
188 
189 // Load parameters.
190 template<typename S>
191 bool PlannerManager<S>::LoadParameters(const ros::NodeHandle& n) {
192  ros::NodeHandle nl(n);
193 
194  // Topics.
195  if (!nl.getParam("topic/ready", ready_topic_)) return false;
196  if (!nl.getParam("topic/traj", traj_topic_)) return false;
197  if (!nl.getParam("topic/ref", ref_topic_)) return false;
198  if (!nl.getParam("topic/replan_request", replan_request_topic_)) return false;
199  if (!nl.getParam("topic/updated_env", updated_env_topic_)) return false;
200  if (!nl.getParam("vis/traj", traj_vis_topic_)) return false;
201  if (!nl.getParam("vis/bound", bound_topic_)) return false;
202 
203  // Frames.
204  if (!nl.getParam("frame/fixed", fixed_frame_)) return false;
205  if (!nl.getParam("frame/planner", planner_frame_)) return false;
206 
207  // Time step.
208  if (!nl.getParam("time_step", time_step_)) return false;
209 
210  // Planner runtime, start, and goal.
211  if (!nl.getParam("planner_runtime", planner_runtime_)) return false;
212  if (!nl.getParam("start", start_.x)) return false;
213  if (!nl.getParam("goal", goal_.x)) return false;
214 
215  return true;
216 }
217 
218 // Register callbacks.
219 template<typename S>
220 bool PlannerManager<S>::RegisterCallbacks(const ros::NodeHandle& n) {
221  ros::NodeHandle nl(n);
222 
223  // Subscribers.
224  ready_sub_ = nl.subscribe(ready_topic_.c_str(), 1,
225  &PlannerManager<S>::ReadyCallback, this);
226 
227  traj_sub_ = nl.subscribe(traj_topic_.c_str(), 1,
228  &PlannerManager<S>::TrajectoryCallback, this);
229 
230  updated_env_sub_ = nl.subscribe(updated_env_topic_.c_str(), 1,
231  &PlannerManager<S>::UpdatedEnvironmentCallback, this);
232 
233  // Publishers.
234  ref_pub_ = nl.advertise<fastrack_msgs::State>(ref_topic_.c_str(), 1, false);
235 
236  replan_request_pub_ = nl.advertise<fastrack_msgs::ReplanRequest>(
237  replan_request_topic_.c_str(), 1, false);
238 
239  bound_pub_ = nl.advertise<visualization_msgs::Marker>(
240  bound_topic_.c_str(), 1, false);
241 
242  traj_vis_pub_ = nl.advertise<visualization_msgs::Marker>(
243  traj_vis_topic_.c_str(), 1, false);
244 
245  // Timer.
246  timer_ = nl.createTimer(ros::Duration(time_step_),
247  &PlannerManager<S>::TimerCallback, this);
248 
249  return true;
250 }
251 
252 // If not already waiting, request a new trajectory that starts along the
253 // current trajectory at the state corresponding to when the planner will
254 // return, and ends at the goal location. This may be overridden by derived
255 // classes with more specific replanning needs.
256 template<typename S>
257 void PlannerManager<S>::MaybeRequestTrajectory() {
258  if (!ready_ || waiting_for_traj_)
259  return;
260 
261  // Set start and goal states.
262  fastrack_msgs::ReplanRequest msg;
263  msg.start = start_;
264  msg.goal = goal_;
265 
266  // Set start time.
267  msg.start_time = ros::Time::now().toSec() + planner_runtime_;
268 
269  // Reset start state for future state if we have a current trajectory.
270  if (traj_.Size() > 0) {
271  // Catch trajectory that's too short.
272  if (traj_.LastTime() < msg.start_time) {
273  ROS_ERROR("%s: Current trajectory is too short. Cannot interpolate.",
274  name_.c_str());
275  msg.start = traj_.LastState().ToRos();
276  } else {
277  msg.start = traj_.Interpolate(msg.start_time).ToRos();
278  }
279  }
280 
281  // Publish request and set flag.
282  replan_request_pub_.publish(msg);
283  waiting_for_traj_ = true;
284 }
285 
286 // Callback for applying tracking controller.
287 template<typename S>
288 void PlannerManager<S>::TimerCallback(const ros::TimerEvent& e) {
289  if (!ready_)
290  return;
291 
292  if (traj_.Size() == 0) {
293  MaybeRequestTrajectory();
294  return;
295  } else if (traj_.Size() == 0 && waiting_for_traj_) {
296  ROS_WARN_THROTTLE(1.0, "%s: Waiting for trajectory.", name_.c_str());
297  return;
298  }
299 
300  // Interpolate the current trajectory.
301  const S planner_x = traj_.Interpolate(ros::Time::now().toSec());
302 
303  // Convert to ROS msg and publish.
304  ref_pub_.publish(planner_x.ToRos());
305 
306  // Broadcast transform.
307  geometry_msgs::TransformStamped tf;
308  tf.header.frame_id = fixed_frame_;
309  tf.header.stamp = ros::Time::now();
310  tf.child_frame_id = planner_frame_;
311 
312  tf.transform.translation.x = planner_x.X();
313  tf.transform.translation.y = planner_x.Y();
314  tf.transform.translation.z = planner_x.Z();
315  tf.transform.rotation.x = 0;
316  tf.transform.rotation.y = 0;
317  tf.transform.rotation.z = 0;
318  tf.transform.rotation.w = 1;
319 
320  tf_broadcaster_.sendTransform(tf);
321 }
322 
323 } //\namespace planning
324 } //\namespace fastrack
